My parents: :/ no she's not :/// you just see any character you like and say she's gay ://// why does...
body:
Me: Captain Marvel is gay

My parents: :/ no she’s not :/// you just see any character you like and say she’s gay ://// why does she have to be gay :/// just because she wasn’t with a man doesnt mean shes gay :////////// she and Maria had chemistry but they were probably just friends ://///////////////

tags: i totally hijacked captain marvel discussion and turned it into midnight movie discussion
summary: I done learned somethin' today thanks to a post by @comicbookcovers ! Their post was a compilation of Captain Marvel covers over...
body:
I done learned somethin’ today thanks to a post by @comicbookcovers ! Their post was a compilation of Captain Marvel covers over the years, the first of which is the image on the left. It struck me as being very familiar for whatever reason, then I remembered the “Captain Captain” comic from the film The Holy Mountain. You can see from that image on the right that they basically painted over the CM cover.

Why is Captain Captain fighting Peruvians? Well, in the Holy Mountain it was said that Peru was the next South American country scheduled for a violent revolution and therefore would require some good ol’ ‘Murrican Democracization. Children were being conditioned to hate and fear Peruvians so that when they inevitably were sent off to intervene in a revolution, they wouldn’t feel so terrible about, you know, invading these people’s country. The Captain Captain comic was just one form of toy-market propaganda doing that job. I mean, I think that’s what was happening. It’s a weird movie.

CC here I think is intended to represent the past (and often present) history of comics as propaganda. Captain-America-punching-a- Japanese-dude-for-freedom type thing. I’m not familiar with this Captain Marvel comic so I don’t know if there’s specific reason it was chosen to parody, I think they may have just been going with aesthetics and something quick to repaint.

But point is now I know the original identity of Captain Captain! Now that I see them side by side the fact that it’s not an original is quite glaringly ovious. 😅

summary: Write that one shot, op. Bless the world with some ramvers(or danbeau is what I think is the most common ship name now. Theres...
question: Write that one shot, op. Bless the world with some ramvers(or danbeau is what I think is the most common ship name now. Theres also Marol)
answer:
wow, I am so sorry I’m just now getting to this, my brain was scattered last week because I didn’t have any classes. 

And thank you for the education, I’ve seen mariacarol, but I just saw a gifset calling them TOP GAY (i added the caps for emphasis) so that’s what I’m going to refer to these wives as because of course they are.

summary: Carol Danvers is a l e s b i a n
question: Carol Danvers is a l e s b i a n
answer:
Yeah and? I hc her equally as bi and as a lesbian because I love both interpretations of her character. Also I happen to hc her as having female preference in general whether I’m living for her as a bi, ace, or homo icon. And I like her as ALL OF THE ABOVE.

Honestly I already knew biphobia was a thing but the amount of ppl getting pissy on my ‘bisexual superhero alignment’ shitpost because “no carol is a LESBIAN!!!! how dare you suggest she not be a pure homosexual!” is… wow

summary: In Captain Marvel when they are fighting in the records/ filing room thingy, the aisle they are in front of at one point starts...
body: In Captain Marvel when they are fighting in the records/ filing room thingy, the aisle they are in front of at one point starts at ”CA- something”. I was on edge for that entire scene once I noticed they were fighting in front of the row Steves records could be filed under. THIS means they missed a real big easter egg opportunity by not having Fury or Carol grab the “Captain America” record to smack someone the fuck out with it. Just saying.
